docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 14 -- Following are items proposed for inclusion in the regular and supplementary agenda of the thirteenth regular session of the United Nations General Assembly, which will convene here Tuesday. Explanatory material...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 14 -- Following are items proposed for inclusion in the regular and supplementary agenda of the thirteenth regular session of the United Nations General Assembly, which will convene here Tuesday. Explanatory material within parentheses was compiled by the United Nations Department of Public Information.

headline.main: Items Proposed for the Agenda of the 13th Session of the U. N. General Assembly

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 16 -- Dr. Charles Malik, the pro-Western Foreign Minister of Lebanon, was elected president of the General Assembly as to opened its 1958 session today. He defeated Mohammed Ahmed Mahgoub, Foreign Minister of the Sudan.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 16 -- Dr. Charles Malik, the pro-Western Foreign Minister of Lebanon, was elected president of the General Assembly as to opened its 1958 session today. He defeated Mohammed Ahmed Mahgoub, Foreign Minister of the Sudan.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 17 -- The Steering Committee of the General Assembly today postponed until tomorrow consideration of the issue of the admission of Communist China to the United Nations.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 -- A number of Latin-American Republics will announce at the Pan-American Sanitary conference a major stride forward in public health -- eradication of the mosquito that carries urban yellow fever. The conference opens tomorrow...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 -- A number of Latin-American Republics will announce at the Pan-American Sanitary conference a major stride forward in public health -- eradication of the mosquito that carries urban yellow fever. The conference opens tomorrow in San Juan, Puerto Rico.
docs.abstract: Dr C L Gonzalez repts Latin-Amer nations have virtually eradicated urban type

docs.snippet: A very firm undertone prevailed for the British pound sterling in active dealings during the past week. This was attributed to the greatly improved position of the gold and dollar reserves held by the Treasury. Canadian dollar moved narrowly on...
docs.lead_paragraph: A very firm undertone prevailed for the British pound sterling in active dealings during the past week. This was attributed to the greatly improved position of the gold and dollar reserves held by the Treasury. Canadian dollar moved narrowly on transactions to fill routine requirements.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended Oct. 3, 1958

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 8 -- The Soviet Union urged the United Nations today to give priority in General Assembly discussion to its proposal for a prohibition of further tests of nuclear weapons.
